attributes.action: Call for an early General Election
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of people within government have changed since the last general election, a change of leadership and over 60 resignations including many senior ministers, and the government has had several controversies (including breaches of ministerial conduct) come to light, indicating a culture of irresponsibility.

A general election would help reaffirm that the government in power is representative of the people and in their favour.
attributes.background: Bring forward the next general election forward to no later than September 2023.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Call an immediate general election to end the chaos of the current government
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

Set the date of the next General Election for 2 May 2023
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611905

Hold a General Election within 100 days of the new PM being appointed
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621931

If a Prime Minister resigns a general election should be called
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620016
